name: Refrigerator Corn Relish
description: This colorful, mildly spicy relish is sweet, but not as sweet by a long shot as many corn relish recipes I’ve seen and tasted.  It goes well with everything from burgers to tofu sandwiches. You can add more chiles to the recipe if you want a spicier relish.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, kosher, low cholesterol, low-fat, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, fall, summer, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 small or medium red bell pepper, finely diced
1 small or medium green bell pepper, finely diced
1 serrano or jalapeño chile, minced (more to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add corn. Boil 3 minutes and transfer to a bowl of ice water. When corn is cool enough to handle, pat dry and cut kernels from cobs. Set aside.

In a medium-size, heavy pot combine vinegar, sugar, water, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, celery seeds and salt and bring to a boil. Stir until sugar has dissolved and add onion. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add peppers, garlic and chile and simmer for another 5 minutes. Stir in corn and simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat and pack into hot sterilized pint jars. Seal and allow to cool. Store in the refrigerator.
